definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: The encyclopedia has been published in parts.
sentences.chinese: 这套百科全书已分册出版。

sentences.english: I bought a handbook of English grammar last week.
sentences.chinese: 《实用英语语法手册》将分册出版。

sentences.english: Students are able to choose the following individual volume according to their own situation.
sentences.chinese: 学员也可根据个人具体情况单独分册学习。

sentences.english: Zhou Lan glanced at the judges who were busy writing on their mark sheets.
sentences.chinese: 周兰瞥了一眼忙着在记分册上打分的裁判。

sentences.english: The work will appear in parts.
Publication fascicule book, best can indicate respectively price.
sentences.chinese: 出版分册书，最好能分别标明定价。

definition: a series of books/a collection of books
entire book/unabridged book/entire multi-volume work/comprehensive volume
reference book (such as dictionary, almanac, gazetteer etc)
reference book consisting of material quoted from many sources, arranged by category (about 600 of which were compiled between the 3rd and 18th centuries in China)
